commit.message:
test: fix bashisms in tests

We're using a /bin/sh shebang but the tests aren't
compatible with a POSIX-compliant /bin/sh (like dash,
instead of the usual bash).

Switch to = instead of == which works the same but
works with both Bash and dash.

If desired, we could switch the shebangs to
/bin/bash which would work.

(Notably, Debian defaults to dash as /bin/sh).

Merge pull request #30 from garlick/build_fixes

misc. build fixes

committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1626963359 -0700

Merge pull request #30 from garlick/build_fixes

misc. build fixes

commit.message:
build: use git describe --tags for lightweight tags

Problem: scrub has only lightweight tags so far, but the
change to get the version from git describe --always only
works on annotated tags.

Add the --tags option to grok the existing lightweight tags.

test: fix missing include in test program

Problem: tgetsize emits a compiler warning because
strerror() is not defined.

Include string.h to get the definition of strerror.

build: silence autogen error

Problem: the autogen.sh test for glibtoolize emits an expected
error when the test fails, making it look like something is
wrong when it is not.

Redirect the test stderr to /dev/null.

build: set AM_SILENT_RULES

Problem: build output is extremely verbose

Set AM_SILENT_RULES.

build: fully expunge AUTHORS file

Problem: previous PR removed the AUTHORS file but didn't
set 'foreign' automake mode (e.g. indicating a non GNU
template project), and didn't drop AUTHORS from Makefile.am
or invocation of the X_AC_META macro from configure.ac.

Update Makefile.am and configure.ac

Merge pull request #29 from garlick/misc_cleanup

fix outdated headers, extra whitespace, and autogen problem

committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1626890855 -0700

Merge pull request #29 from garlick/misc_cleanup

fix outdated headers, extra whitespace, and autogen problem

commit.message:
update license headers to short SPDX form

Problem: license headers are using an outdated form, and
are missing from some source modules.

Update to a more modern, abbreviated SPDX header.

build: drop META file

Problem: project still uses old META file from chaos build system.

Drop META file and update users.

drop the AUTHORS file

Problem: AUTHORS file is sporadically maintained and is redundant
with the git commit log.

Drop AUTHORS.

drop spaces at end of line

Problem: scrub source code and documentation contains the
occasional space at end of line.  This is considered poor
practice by many.

Drop trailing spaces.  This commit is purely cosmetic.

build: pull in libcgrypt.m4

Problem: autogen.sh fails if libgcrypt-dev is not installed.

Pull in missing libgcrypt.m4 so users who build scrub from git,
as opposed to a dist tarball, aren't faced with an error like:

configure.ac:94: error: possibly undefined macro: AM_PATH_LIBGCRYPT
      If this token and others are legitimate, please use m4_pattern_allow.
      See the Autoconf documentation.

Merge pull request #24 from sergio-correia/fixes

Fixes for issues found by clang static analyzer

commit.message:
Minor fixes to keep clang static analyzer happy

- Initialize `written' and `checked' in scrub()
- Initialize `mp->thd' before using it in refill_init()
- Do not assign return of read_all() to `n', if we do not read this
  value, in writesig()

verification.payload:
tree 067da0f589ca75ebbc88a065411f0bc6a12cc53b
parent 62bc12807948c0e9688e5810769a4f48d3e223dd
author Sergio Correia <scorreia@redhat.com> 1615979287 -0300
committer Sergio Correia <scorreia@redhat.com> 1615979533 -0300

Minor fixes to keep clang static analyzer happy

- Initialize `written' and `checked' in scrub()
- Initialize `mp->thd' before using it in refill_init()
- Do not assign return of read_all() to `n', if we do not read this
  value, in writesig()

commit.message:
Fix leak in refill_init()

When allocating the buffer fails in refill_init(), we returned
without free()ing `mp', which we had just allocated.

verification.payload:
tree a8ce5624d707b18ba5afd3d4d4d8e20dac1191ce
parent 9f15f2bc06ab6d6282edf7a799c5ac7c544bff59
author Sergio Correia <scorreia@redhat.com> 1615979183 -0300
committer Sergio Correia <scorreia@redhat.com> 1615979183 -0300

Fix leak in refill_init()

When allocating the buffer fails in refill_init(), we returned
without free()ing `mp', which we had just allocated.

Merge pull request #21 from sergio-correia/remove-aes-use-libgcrypt

Use libgcrypt by default instead of custom crypto

commit.message:
Use libgcrypt by default instead of custom crypto

When libgcrypt is available, use it instead of our custom AES
implementation.

If we want to use the legacy AES code, we can disable libgcrypt
explictly with --disable-libgcrypt.

Based on a patch by Daniel Kopecek.

verification.payload:
tree 2e3ace565f48f17452af1d756cfbf881b2662f3e
parent b90fcb2330d00dbd1e9aeaa2e1a9807f8b80b922

committer Sergio Correia <scorreia@redhat.com> 1613683811 -0300

Use libgcrypt by default instead of custom crypto

When libgcrypt is available, use it instead of our custom AES
implementation.

If we want to use the legacy AES code, we can disable libgcrypt
explictly with --disable-libgcrypt.

Based on a patch by Daniel Kopecek.

scrub should work for symlinks pointing to block devices

verification.payload:
tree 31a57332ccc0d5f4d841513a0e901797af51ccae
parent 030879c9cd8bb5c8bc1e95b403e2d05ae75c1978
parent 499a491c21b5a18be79334282dfa11fd4f408c49
author Jim Garlick <garlick.jim@gmail.com> 1611766519 -0800
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1611766519 -0800

Merge pull request #20 from sergio-correia/symlinks-to-block-devices

scrub should work for symlinks pointing to block devices

commit.message:
scrub should work for symlinks pointing to block devices

In [1] (add -L option to avoid scrubbing symlink target [Tim
Boronczyk]), scrub introduced a -L (--no-link) option so that it would
not scrub the target, if it was a link and this new option was set.

A side-effect of that change is that scrub stopped working for links
pointing to a block device, whereas it would still work for links
pointing to regular files -- it is not clear from the commit changelog
and the added documentation for this new option that this was an
intended change.

In this commit we fix this regression, and scrub works again for links
pointing to block devices. -L/--no-link option also works for these
links.

[1] https://github.com/chaos/scrub/commit/01915c442288b4b274261fa07e42e116fb9d6b60

verification.payload:
tree 31a57332ccc0d5f4d841513a0e901797af51ccae
parent 030879c9cd8bb5c8bc1e95b403e2d05ae75c1978
author Sergio Correia <scorreia@redhat.com> 1611751335 -0300
committer Sergio Correia <scorreia@redhat.com> 1611765463 -0300

scrub should work for symlinks pointing to block devices

In [1] (add -L option to avoid scrubbing symlink target [Tim
Boronczyk]), scrub introduced a -L (--no-link) option so that it would
not scrub the target, if it was a link and this new option was set.

A side-effect of that change is that scrub stopped working for links
pointing to a block device, whereas it would still work for links
pointing to regular files -- it is not clear from the commit changelog
and the added documentation for this new option that this was an
intended change.

In this commit we fix this regression, and scrub works again for links
pointing to block devices. -L/--no-link option also works for these
links.

[1] https://github.com/chaos/scrub/commit/01915c442288b4b274261fa07e42e116fb9d6b60
